clinical_study.brief_title: Severe Acquired Brain Injuries: Prognostic Factors and Quality of Care
clinical_study.official_title: TIRESIA Project - Severe Acquired Brain Injuries: Prognostic Factors and Quality of Care

lead_sponsor.agency: Mario Negri Institute for Pharmacological Research

clinical_study.source: Mario Negri Institute for Pharmacological Research

brief_summary.textblock:
The main purpose of this project is to identify the medium-term prognostic factors for patients with Severe Acquired Brain Injuries and evaluate their impact.
The secondary aim is to create a system of continuous assessment of the quality of care for each rehabilitation unit.

primary_outcome.description: Removal of the tracheostomy tube, which is considered successful if the patient is not to be re-cannulated within 7 days

Achievement of trunk control, for which the patient must be able to maintain the sitting position for at least 60 seconds, on a rigid surface, with the lower limbs in support, but without support from the upper limbs and without rear support of the trunk
Oral feeding with sufficient caloric intake

arm_group.arm_group_label: Adults admitted in participating Rehabilitation Units for Severe Acquired Brain Injuries
arm_group.description: Adults admitted in study's participants Rehabilitation Units for Severe Acquired Brain Injuries from the 1st of July 2021 to the 31st of December 2023. Patients entered into these units more than 14 weeks after the acute event are excluded

study_pop.textblock: All patients admitted in the Rehabilitation Units for Severe Acquired Brain Injuries participating in the study during the 30 months of enrollment provided by the research

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with Serious Acquired Brain Injuries
- admission to rehabilitation units
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients admitted more than 14 weeks after the acute event
